poem:
**The Shifting Landscape**

from north to south,  
the ink fades quiet—  
a name, removed;  
in the tremor of politics,  
where scholars once stood  
steadfast,  
florida sun looms large—  
dollars, the guiding stars,  
while words of warning  
scatter like leaves  
in autumn's  
unforgiving breeze.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘From all sides’: universities in red states face attacks from DC and at home Days after the University of Michigan president, Santa Ono, announced that he was leaving his post to lead the University of Florida, his name was quietly removed on Wednesday from a letter signed by more than 600 university presidents denouncing the Trump administration’s “unprecedented government overreach and political interference” with academic institutions. As Ono is set to become the highest-paid public". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
